(b) Find the coordinates of a point on the curve at which the line tangent to the curve is horizontal, or explain why no such point exists.
(c) Find the coordinates of a point on the curve at which the line tangent to the curve is vertical, or explain why no such point exists.

(d) A particle is moving along the curve. At the instant when the particle is at the point <math alttext="with coordinates one half comma negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mpadded><mo>,</mo><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, its horizontal position is increasing at a rate of <math alttext="the derivative of x with respect to t, equals two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> unit per second. What is the value of <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>, the rate of change of the particle’s vertical position, at that instant?
